activities: Personal Information Received from the EU/EEA and/or Switzerland: DayNine uses personal information that it receives from the EU/EEA and Switzerland for marketing activities as permissible under applicable law.  In addition, as part of DayNine’s professional services operations, DayNine processes data, including personal data, on behalf of its customers. In this context, DayNine acts as a data processor and does not control the data. Furthermore, DayNine also collects, transfers and uses personal information of its employees and candidates for general employment and benefit purposes (e.g., providing compensation benefits and related services, keeping updated organizational information, making employment-related decisions, administering stock option programs, managing security, and employee training). As part of DayNine’s internal operations, DayNine transfers personal data of its employees and non-employee personnel to the U.S. headquarters for processing and storage. In this context, DayNine acts as a data controller.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Organization, customer, prospect (both automated and manually processed)
